meanings.definition: The quality of retaining or remembering information.
meanings.sent1: Her retentivenesses in class helped her ace the exam.
meanings.sent2: His retentivenesses of historical facts amazed his friends.
meanings.sent3: The retentivenesses of the computer's memory was impressive.
meanings.sent4: The retentivenesses of the book's plot kept me engaged.
meanings.sent5: The retentivenesses of the student's mind was like a steel trap.

meanings.definition: The ability to hold onto or keep something.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel's retentivenesses of nuts for winter was remarkable.
meanings.sent2: The retentivenesses of the jar kept the cookies fresh.
meanings.sent3: His retentivenesses of his favorite toy was comical.
meanings.sent4: The retentivenesses of the magnet to metal was strong.
meanings.sent5: The retentivenesses of the glue to paper was impressive.

meanings.definition: The state of being able to maintain or preserve.
meanings.sent1: The retentivenesses of the old building's structure was remarkable.
meanings.sent2: The retentivenesses of the organization's records was crucial.
meanings.sent3: The retentivenesses of the fridge to keep food cold was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The retentivenesses of the seal on the letter was strong.
meanings.sent5: The retentivenesses of the sunscreen to protect skin was important.
